Reason: The 'key_cache_save_period' configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. This configuration determines how often the key cache is saved to disk, affecting memory consumption and read performance. A shorter save period may increase memory usage but improve read performance, while a longer save period may reduce memory usage but decrease read performance. Therefore, any change in this configuration can lead to notable variations in execution time and memory consumption, making it performance-sensitive.
